data.client_settings: If only there was an easy way to check it... But according to my extensive "researches" its Desktop Canary 163 and Desktop Stable 297
data.actual_result: Some files from the cache can't be uploaded despite being <8MB of size. This only happens for very specific files. Uploading files directly as a file from your PC works as intended (even with the same file)
data.expected_result: If the file is smaller than 8MB, you should be able to upload it just fine
data.short_description: Uploading pictures from the cache directly, sometimes gives a "file too powerful" error despite being small enough.
data.steps_to_repro: - Step1: Open a file in a browser of your choice (smaller than 8mb) - Step1\_2: example image which is triggering the bug for me and some other people: <http://konachan.com/image/2f16ff40220dda6a836a53dd01b2ceef/Konachan.com%20-%20240890%20animal_ears%20aqua_eyes%20blush%20catgirl%20dress%20final_fantasy%20final_fantasy_xiv%20flowers%20gray_hair%20maid%20miqo%27te%20short_hair%20signed%20tail%20yana_mori.jpg> - Step3: Rightclick on the image you want to upload - Step4: Select "Copy Image" - Step6: Paste the image into discord - Step7: It gives off a "file too powerful" error despite the file being too small - Alternative: Download the image to your desktop and then upload the file directly works as intended (no "File too powerfull" error)
